article.headline: Bed Bath and Beyond sees 'positive' same-store sales, cash flow in June
article.body: Shares of Bed Bath & Beyond Inc. BBBY, -1.37% rose 1.1% in premarket trading Tuesday, after the home accessories retailer said June same-store sales were "positive" for reopened stores and digital channels. The company said cash flow during June were also positive. Nearly all stores have reopened, following closures because of the COVID-19 pandemic. Separately, the company said it believes there is between $350 million to $450 million it could get from asset sales and the plan to reduce up to $1 billion of inventory at retail is slightly more than halfway complete. The stock has run up 43.9% over the past three months through Monday, while the SPDR S&P Retail ETF XRT, +0.05% has advanced 25.3% and the S&P 500 SPX, +0.87% has gained 10.9%.
